column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#Text=[0072] Seven grams of C.I.

#Text=Pigment Blue 15:3 having a specific surface area of 90 m.sup.2/g, 20.0 mmol of sodium ((4-aminobenzoylamino)-methane-1,1-diyl)bisphosphonate, 57.0 mmol of nitric acid and 200 mL of pure water were mixed at room temperature and 6,000 rpm by a Silverson mixer.
#Text=After minutes, a solution with 57.0 mmol of sodium nitrite dissolved in a small amount of water was added into this mixture, and mixing was further conducted.
#Text=The mixing was conducted for 1 hour in a state in which the temperature had reached 60.degree.
#Text=C. by the addition and mixing.
#Text=Thereafter, the pH of the mixture was adjusted to 10.0 with an aqueous potassium hydroxide solution.

#Text=After 30 minutes, this mixture was subjected to ultrafiltration with 20 parts of pure water, and water was further added to disperse the pigment in such a manner that the content of the pigment is 10.0% by mass, thereby preparing a pigment dispersion.
#Text=By the above-described process, was obtained Pigment Dispersion K in a state in which C.I.

#Text=Pigment Blue 15:3 in which a bisphosphonic acid group whose counter ion was potassium was bonded to the surface of the pigment particle through an atomic group containing --C.sub.6H.sub.4--CONH-- (benzamide structure) was dispersed in water.
#Text=The surface charge amount of the self-dispersion pigment prepared above was measured by the method described above and was found to be 0.43 mmol/g.
#Text=Incidentally, the pH of the Pigment Dispersion K was 10.0, and the average particle size of the pigment was 120 nm.
#Text=Preparation of Pigment Dispersion L
#Text=[0073] In a state of being cooled to 5.degree.
#Text=C., 8.28 mmol of 4-amino-phthalic acid was added into a solution with 60 mmol of concentrated hydrochloric acid dissolved in 5.5 g of water.
#Text=A container containing this solution was then placed in an ice bath, thereby constantly keeping the solution at a temperature not higher than 10.degree.
#Text=C.
#Text=In this state, a solution with 21.2 mmol of sodium nitrite dissolved in 9 g of water at 5.degree.
#Text=C. was added into this solution.
#Text=After this solution was stirred additionally for minutes, 6 g of Black Pearls 880 (product of Cabot) having a specific surface area of 220 m.sup.2/g was added under stirring.

#Text=Thereafter, the stirring was conducted additionally for 15 minutes, the resultant slurry was filtered through filter paper (trade name: Toyo Filter Paper No. 2; product of Advantec), and the resultant particle was fully washed with water.
#Text=This particle was dried in an oven controlled to 110.degree.
#Text=C. to prepare a self-dispersion carbon black.

#Text=In addition, water was added to the resultant self-dispersion carbon black, the pH of the resultant mixture was adjusted to 10.0 with an aqueous potassium hydroxide solution, and the pigment was dispersed in such a manner that the content of the pigment is 10.0% by mass, thereby preparing a dispersion liquid.

#Text=By the above-described process, was obtained Pigment Dispersion L in a state in which a carbon black in which a phthalic acid group whose counter ion was potassium was bonded to the surface of the carbon black particle was dispersed in water.
#Text=Incidentally, the content of the pigment in the Pigment Dispersion L prepared above was 10.0% by mass, the pH thereof was 10.0, and the average particle size of the pigment was 120 nm.
#Text=In addition, the surface charge amount of the pigment as measured by the method described above was 0.34 mmol/g.
#Text=Preparation of Pigment Dispersion M

#Text=[0074] Twenty-five grams of Black Pearls 880 (product of Cabot) having a specific surface area of 220 m.sup.2/g and a solution with 24.5 mmol of sulfanilic acid dissolved in hot water were mixed, and stirring was conducted until the temperature of the solution reached 30.degree.
#Text=C.
#Text=Thereafter, 64.0 mmol of concentrated hydrochloric acid was added, and a solution with 23.9 mmol of sodium nitrite dissolved in a small amount of water was added over 1 hour.
#Text=After pure water was then added, and stirring was conducted, the pH of the resultant mixture was adjusted to 9.0 with an aqueous potassium hydroxide solution.
#Text=Thereafter, water was evaporated in an oven until the content of the pigment reached 10. % by mass.

#Text=The mixture was further filtered through a filter having a pore size of 1.2 .mu.m to disperse the pigment in such a manner that the content of the pigment is 10.0% by mass, thereby preparing a pigment dispersion.

#Text=By the above-described process, was obtained Pigment Dispersion M in a state in which a carbon black in which a sulfonic acid group was bonded to the surface of the pigment particle was dispersed in water.
#Text=The surface charge amount of the self-dispersion pigment prepared above was measured by the method described above and was found to be 0.34 mmol/g.
#Text=Incidentally, the pH of the Pigment Dispersion M was 10.0, and the average particle size of the pigment was 120 nm.
